TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 940
TEI.2.document_title: Wyatt Hanks to Stephen F Austin, 04-02-1833

barker_notes.barker_summary: Wyatt Hanks to Austin, April 2, 1833. Giving reasons for not attending the convention.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 940

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Wyatt Hanks to Austin, April 2, 1833. Giving reasons for not attending the convention.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*District of Ayish*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="04-02-1833">April 2 1833*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col S. F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dear Sir, You will please pardon my not answering your very welcome communication at a more early date—*/p*
*p*The apoly offered is absence—as on the arrival I was absent from before the reception of the letter until 2 days since—where I am about establishing *location_mentioned*mills */location_mentioned*and other machinery.*/p*
*p*The extreme season of high water prevented my going as a member until 2-day Since when an unexpected call prevents the possibility of going on There is a member of our *person_mentioned*Eastern delegation*/person_mentioned* going on and it is hoped that the present meeting may be able to meet the emergencies of this eventful crisis-—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*W. Hanks */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*[Address:] *person_mentioned*Col S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*San fillipe De Austin. Texas */location_mentioned*Pr. *person_mentioned*Mr. Wm English.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
